thread.title: US Open winner Flavia Pennetta shocked in Tianjin Open
thread.title_full: US Open winner Flavia Pennetta shocked in Tianjin Open

author: Wires English | Indo-Asian News Service
title: US Open winner Flavia Pennetta shocked in Tianjin Open
text:
US Open winner Flavia Pennetta shocked in Tianjin Open By Indo-Asian News Service on October 13, 2015 at 6:09 PM Comments Tianjin (China), Oct 13: US Open champion Flavia Pennetta was stunned in the first round of WTA Tianjin Open here on Tuesday, losing to Ukraine’s qualifier Lyudmyla Kichenok 6-3, 7-5. The 33-year-old Italian could hardly find her rhythm facing her aggressive opponent and the top seed surrendered in one hour 38 minutes, reports Xinhua. (Read: India can’t afford mistakes like in first ODI: Rohit Sharma) Last week, Pennetta was stopped in the third round by Russian Anastasia Pavlyuchenkova at China Open in Beijing where she said she could change her mind about retirement. Pennetta declared she would quit this year moments after winning the biggest title of her career at last month’s US Open. (Image Credit- wikipedia.org)
